answers.a: E908 here refers to rice bran wax, a food additive, not a device—there’s no “flashboot” process for it.

answers.q: how to make rice bran wax
answers.a: Industrially, it’s obtained by extracting rice bran oil and then dewaxing it via winterization (chilling to crystallize the wax) and filtration, followed by refining.

answers.q: how to separate wax from unrefined rice bran oil
answers.a: Use winterization: cool the oil to precipitate wax crystals, then remove them by filtration or centrifugation; some processes use solvents to aid separation.

answers.q: what is rice bran wax used for
answers.a: In foods (E908) it’s a glazing and release agent used on confectionery, fruits, chewing gum, and bakery items to provide shine and prevent sticking.

answers.q: what is the density of rice bran wax
